text: Anwar Kamal Pasha (1927-1987) was a famous early Pakistani film director and producerhttp://mazhar.dk/film/directors/AnwarKemalPasha.php Retrieved 14 Sept 2014 from Lahore. He dominated the first 20 years of Pakistani cinema. He was the son of noted poet and scholar, Hakim Ahmad Shuja who named him after the Turkish leader Enver Kemal Pasha. Some of Pasha's top hit films were Do Ansoo (1949), Gumnaam (1954), Qatil (1955), Sarfarosh (1956) and Anarkali (1958). From the 1960s, he gradually started making less films and his popularity grew less. ==References== Category:1927 births Category:1987 deaths Category:People from Lahore Category:Pakistani entertainers Category:Cinema of Pakistan
title: Anwar Kamal Pasha
